intro: Cryptantha ambigua f. robustior, commonly known as the robust cryptantha, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
